noun:
Ancient Greek Declensions ; First Declension (Feminine Nouns ending in -α or -η); Example Noun: 'γυνή' (gynē) - 'woman'

Nominative Singular: γυνή (gynē)
Genitive Singular: γυναικός (gynaikós)
Dative Singular: γυναικί (gynaikí)
Accusative Singular: γυναῖκα (gynaika)
Vocative Singular: γύναι (gyna)

Nominative Plural: γυναῖκες (gynaikes)
Genitive Plural: γυναικῶν (gynaikôn)
Dative Plural: γυναιξί (gynaixí)
Accusative Plural: γυναῖκας (gynaikas)
Vocative Plural: γυναῖκες (gynaikes)

; Second Declension (Masculine and Neuter Nouns ending in -ος)
; Example Noun: 'λόγος' (lógos) - 'word'

Nominative Singular: λόγος (lógos)
Genitive Singular: λόγου (lógou)
Dative Singular: λόγῳ (lógō)
Accusative Singular: λόγον (lógon)
Vocative Singular: λόγε (lóge)

Nominative Plural: λόγοι (lógoi)
Genitive Plural: λόγων (lógōn)
Dative Plural: λόγοις (lógois)
Accusative Plural: λόγους (lógoús)
Vocative Plural: λόγοι (lógoi)

; Third Declension (Consonant Stems)
; Example Noun: 'πόλις' (polis) - 'city'

Nominative Singular: πόλις (polis)
Genitive Singular: πόλεως (poleōs)
Dative Singular: πόλει (polei)
Accusative Singular: πόλιν (polin)
Vocative Singular: πόλι (poli)

Nominative Plural: πόλεις (poleis)
Genitive Plural: πόλεων (poleōn)
Dative Plural: πόλεσι (polesi)
Accusative Plural: πόλεις (poleis)
Vocative Plural: πόλεις (poleis)

infinitive:
λύειν λύεσθαι τιμᾶν άει τιμᾶσθαι άε ποιεῖν έει ποιεῖσθαι έε δηλοῦν όει δηλοῦσθαι όε 
Note on the optative forms: Given are the most frequently used forms. In the singular, τιμῷμι, τιμῷς, τιμῷ; ποιοῖμι, ποιοῖς, ποιοῖ; and δηλοῖμι, δηλοῖς, δηλοῖ are also found. 
Alternative forms for the plural follow the pattern of the singular: τιμῴημεν, τιμῴητε, τιμῴησαν; ποιοίημεν, ποιοίητε, ποιοίησαν; δηλοίημεν, δηλοίητε, δηλοίησαν.
